Question.Subject: Websites telling me I need Firefox 3.0+...But I have 3.6?
Question.Content:
Numerous websites I go to keep giving me warnings like this: (remove spaces) http://i44.tiny pic.com/2r7ad14.jpg http://i40.tiny pic.com/fjnjns.jpg http://i39.tiny pic.com/14dlm3m.jpg
But I've downloaded Firefox 3.6 over and over again, and before 3.6 came out I still had the latest version, I always download when there's an update. But now it's saying I have an older version? I don't understand. Also, when I go to my Help-->About Mozilla Firefox I get: http ://i39.tiny pic.com/ay8whg.jpg
Saying that I have 3.6? I don't understand, what am I doing wrong?
-I don't want to switch browsers, I really prefer firefox. -I've uninstalled and reinstalled - No help -I've gone to the site and tried to update manually, still no luck -Tried the alternate shortcut-Nothing -No Updates Available -Bitdefender- No Infections found :( -I've always downloaded it from the Mozilla site
Thank you for the tips so far
Question.ChosenAnswer:
when Firefox is saying that you got latest , then it is latest one for sure )) *grins*
or another possible thing could be that the shortcut link on desktop you have got is pointing to old version firefox's folder. the new version should have the shortcut here:
C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe
also try to update it via : Firefox's Help menu >>Check for updates .
or might be you're infected by any botnet or virus.
http://www.bitdefender.com/scanner/online/free.html
Hope this help
Edit: looking at this image i can see http://i39.tin ypic.com/ay8whg.jpg this is a yahoo edition (although never heard of it)
1.So uninstall any version of mozilla installed from control panel , also remove any yahoo toolbar. 2.Now go to program files : C:\Program Files\ and remove any firefox folder e.g : Mozilla Firefox , yahoo firefox , or look in any yahoo folder that has firefox folder inside or not 3. Go to C:\Documents and Settings\[YOUR_USER_NAME]\Application Data\ and C:\Documents and Settings\[YOUR_USER_NAME]\Local Settings\Application Data and delete the Mozilla folder.
4.Download the firefox from the given links: http://hyperion.zih.tu-dresden.de/moz/firefox/releases/3.6.3/win32/en-US/Firefox%20Setup%203.6.3.exe
http://www.mozilla.com/products/download.html?product=firefox-3.6.3&os=win〈=en-US
P.S : please take any bookmarks backup before doing this , also you can do step 4th as 1st step , download it first.
i hope this time it should help

when Firefox is saying that you got latest , then it is latest one for sure )) *grins*

i hope this time it should help

might have something to do with being a yahoo edition, try uninstalling again and download Firefox 3.6.2 from mozilla
http://www.mozilla.com/en-US/firefox/personal.html
